blocks.name: prmpwdvds
blocks.content: A relation involving divisibility by a prime power. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: pockthg
blocks.content: The generalized Pocklington's theorem. If ` N - 1 = A x. B ` where ` B < A ` , then ` N ` is prime if and only if for every prime factor ` p ` of ` A ` , there is an ` x ` such that ` x ^ ( N - 1 ) = 1 ( mod N ) ` and ` gcd ( x ^ ( ( N - 1 ) / p ) - 1 , N ) = 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: pockthi
blocks.content: Pocklington's theorem, which gives a sufficient criterion for a number ` N ` to be prime. This is the preferred method for verifying large primes, being much more efficient to compute than trial division. This form has been optimized for application to specific large primes; see ~ pockthg for a more general closed-form version. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
